nodes.bodyText: same here

UUID is not necessarily the only ID. Could be a random string, or random number - the requirement is that it is fresh, nonexistent in the current storage

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * @param id id of the new user. Should be generated to random UUID if {@code null}.
          
          
            
                 * @param id id of the new user. Should be generated to random value if {@code null}.

nodes.bodyText:
Changing to lowercase is implementation-specific and should not be prescribed in the javadoc. Generally, the username should rather be stored as entered, and would be searched for in case-insensitive manner should the storage be configured so.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * @param username username, should be changed to lowercase before storing
          
          
            
                 * @param username username.

nodes.bodyText: What is the "social provider ID"? I believe it is an internal ID of a identity provider? A link to `{@link org.keycloak.models.IdentityProviderModel.getInternalId()} could help to disambiguate this.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * Searches for users with username, email or first + last name that is like search string.
          
          
            
                 * Searches for users whose username, email, first or last name contain the any of the strings in {@code search} separated by whitespace.
          
      
    
    
  

Same comment applies below

Prefer constants, e.g. UserModel.FIRST_NAME to plain strings. Suggested change *
  • "firstName" - first name (case insensitive string)
    • *
  • UserModel.FIRST_NAME - first name (case insensitive string)
    • Same comment applies to methods below

Valid parameters are: - * "first" - first name - * "last" - last name - * "email" - email - * "username" - username + * Search for user by a map of parameters. + *

  • "firstName" - first name (case insensitive string)

nodes.bodyText: Implementations do not have to search in {@code UserFederatedStorageProvider} part should clarified / reworded
What is checked in the set of groups?
Please note https://hibernate.atlassian.net/browse/HHH-14295
nit: Can we use if (list.isEmpty()) on line 224, 310 and 495?
I've noticed the Integer.MAX_VALUE - 1, why the -1  is needed?
missing copyright
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+package org.keycloak.models.jpa;

nodes.bodyText: I guess the method is self-explanatory, I've just noticed that there is javadoc for throwIfEmpty. But not for closing one. I'd suggest to add javadoc to all of them, wdyt?

I've noticed you've removed (or not added) the name of the method from @deprecated. I guess it was done for better readability of javadoc, right? Isn't this one omitted?
If so there are other places where the method name is present.
One way or another I'd suggest to unify it, wdyt? I've commented with word 'name' to other occurrences I've found.
But maybe I'm missing something and it really should be this way, in that case please ignore this one and all 'name' comments :)

nodes.bodyText: I wonder if the original class-level javadoc (line 23,24) shouldn't be updated as well. I might be wrong, but it seems to me it's outdated.

nodes.bodyText:
It seems this change changes the behavior, doesn't it? Previously when maxResult was equal 0 the method returned empty stream, while now there won't be any stream.limit(maxResult) (if I understand the StreamsUtil.paginatedStream correctly).
Anyway your changes seems correct to me, I was just wondering if it was a bugfix. But maybe I'm missing something.
Is there any other work remaining as TODO? If not, I'd suggest remove all 5 TODO comments, if so is there any plan for it?
nit: forgotten white characters
Don't we need to ensure that maxResult is not null?
This note needs elaborating The paragraphs need to be separated by

 import java.util.stream.Stream;
 
 /**
- * Optional capability interface implemented by UserStorageProviders.

- * if you want to view and manager users from the administration console.
+ * if you want to view and manage users from the administration console.
+ *

nodes.bodyText:
Good catch @vramik. These methods need to fulfil the contract given in javadoc, and thus need to count in the federated storages as well
[EDIT] @mhajas has convinced me that this is not a straightforward cleanup because of requirements it has on handling e.g. imported users and those from the original storage. Let's keep this in a separate task
